sub_topic: Identifying the planarity of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph G shown below:

![Graph G](https://i.imgur.com/dA20ZnT.png)

Determine whether the graph G is planar or not. If it is planar, draw a planar representation of the graph. If it is not planar, provide a justification for your answer.
message_2:
The graph G is planar. A graph is planar if it can be drawn in a plane without any edges crossing. To show this, we can redraw the graph with a different arrangement of the vertices and edges.

Here is a planar representation of the graph G:

```
    A---B
   /|   |\
  / |   | \
 F--E---C--D
```

In this representation, none of the edges cross each other, so the graph G is planar.
